p: An important antimicrobial property of essential oils and their components is their hydrophobicity, which enables them to partition with the lipids of the bacterial cell wall, cell membrane, and mitochondria, causing increased permeability of these membranes. Additionally, ions leakage from these membranes can lead to bacterial cell damage and death ( Solorzano-Santos and Miranda-Novales, 2012). The bacterial populations in vase solutions of Lisianthus flowers treated with thyme oil were less than the other treatments ( Kazemi etÂ al., 2011).
